intro: Cymopterus beckii, commonly known as the Beck's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open to release the seeds when mature.
